article.headline: As praries make a comback, bison roam

metadata.narrative_thread: ...because bisons grazing habits help prairies grow.

content.question: Why does the prairie need help?
content.answer: During WWII, it served as an arsenal and produced 1 billion lbs. of TNT.

content.question: What's the difference between bison and bufalo?
content.answer: Bison can help restore native grasses and flowering plants that will provide a better habitat for grassland birds.

content.description_text: Number of years it will take to evaluate whether the bisons have improved the diversity of native plants and birds.
Midewin National Tallgrass Prairie, located about 50 miles southwest of Chicago.

content.question: Where else do the bufalo roam?
content.answer: In October, The Nature Conservancy brought 30 bison to Nachusa Grasslands to help with prairie restoration--the first conservation herd in Illinois.

content.quote_attribution: Jeff Walk, director of science for the Illinois chapter of The Nature Conservancy
